suncertify.db
Class CombinedTable

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.CombinedTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
LockManager, Table
final class CombinedTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements LockManager, Table

A database table that combines the functionality of a Table and a LockManager in order to manage its own locks. We maintain a collection of LockableRecord objects in a ConcurrentMap, in a similar fashion to Multiversion Concurrency Control but with only a single version of each record. The locks are never deleted, but they may be reused if their corresponding Record is deleted and replaced with another Record. This class is thread safe.

getAllRecords

public java.util.Collection<LockableRecord> getAllRecords()
Get all the records, together with their locks. The collection returned may not reflect changes to records that occur while the method is being performed.

addExistingRecord

public void addExistingRecord(Record newRecord)
Add an existing Record to the table, for example when populating the table from a database file. The Record will not be written to file.

createRecord

public Record createRecord(java.util.List<Field> fields)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Create a Record from the given fields, and add it to the table. The new Record will be written to the database file, possibly reusing the number of a deleted Record. The new Record will not be marked as deleted.

Specified by:
createRecord in interface Table
Parameters:
fields - the fields of the Record to be created
Returns:

Throws:
